718754f-b.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Jackson Street
718754f-b.text:
(1)
408-420 Cherry Street, north side, between Jackaon and Scammel
Streets. The 3-story garage is No. 420.
March 23, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A view solely of the former stable No. 420.
March 23, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

719219f-a.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Jackson Street
719219f-a.text:
Corlears Hook Park: A panoramic set of 2 views, westward from the
East River, showing this play area that is bounded by Jackson (left),
Cherry (background) and Corlears (right) Streets. Upon the latter are
two factory structures, one occupied by Hecker Jones, Jewell Milling
Co., and the other by the Standard Milling Co. These buildings obscure
a view of the Williamsburg Bridge, which is slightly northward.
July 10, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719219f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Jackson Street, Manhattan, NY

718757f-b.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Jackson Street
718757f-b.text:
(1)
Cherry Street, North Side and Northwards acroos Jackson Street,
cornering on the Colears Hook Park.
October 7, 1939
(2)
Cherry Street, North Side and east from Scanimel Street,
showing demolition on the North east corner.
August 14, 1939.
(3)
Cherry Street, North Side looking eastwards of Corlears
street, showing Arch of East River Bridge, also W.P.A.
reccnstruction work.
P.L.Speer.
No Reproductlon.  October 7, 1939.

718758f-a.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Jackson Street
718758f-a.text:
Cherry Street, north side, east of Jackson Street, showing
tenements prior to demolition. This slum clearance project will
provide a site for the ''Vladeck Houses.''
April 25, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPPODUCTIONS

719216f-a.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Jackson Street
719216f-a.text:
Corlears Hook Park: A northward view towards Cherry
Street from the East River. At the left and right,
respectively are Jackson and Corlears Street. On the
formar, at Madison Street, is the instutional P. S. 12.
This appears because of the demolition of several blocks
of tenements that formerly would obscure the view. Upon
this prepared site will rise the N. Y. City and the U. S.
H. A. Houses, the Vladeck City Houses and tho Vladeck
Houses. Skirting the waters edge will be the East River
Drive.
July 28, 1939
Sept 18, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
719216f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Jackson Street, Manhattan, NY

719217f-b.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Jackson Street
719217f-b.text:
Corloars Hook Park: A northward view from the East
River shore. In the background are buildings on the
marginal Cherry Street, axtending from Jackson Street
on the laft to Corlears Street on the right. The bandw
stand is in a line with these. Those to the left are
to be removed for the N. Y. City built, Vladeck Houses.
The new East River Lrive will skirt the waters edge.
April 25, 1939
May 7, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
719217f-b.folder: Cherry Street & Jackson Street, Manhattan, NY

718755f-a.title: Manhattan: Cherry Street - Jackson Street
718755f-a.text:
Cherry 8treet, east from, No. 424, a garage, west of the N.W. cor-
Mner of Jackson Street. Note the Williamsburg Bridge in the backgronnd.
March 23, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
A similar view, showing mainly the south side. The building whose
side wall is vividly apparent, is No. 423.
March 23, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
Aview of the same area shown in No. 1 from a point
slightly receded and as in that instance, across Jackson Street.
These buildings are being demolished for the Vladeck City Houses,
a project finaced by the City and its adjoining Vladeck Houses,
n USFA sponsered feature. The shells of tenements appearing at
the left are at the S.W. corner of Monroe and Jackson Streets.
718755f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Jackson Street, Manhattan, NY

720659f-b.title: Manhattan: Jackson Street - Cherry Street
720659f-b.text:
(1)
47-49 Jackson Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Cherry Street.
Buildings shown are of frame, with brick fronts. Note the Cherry Street
side of same.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of Now York.
Hegative No. 4.
CREDIT LINE IIPERATIVE ON ALL REPRRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, including the lower stories of Nos. 43 and 41 Jaokson Street,
at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Cherry Street.
May 1929.
Eugene 1  Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE EMoDUcED.
720659f-b.folder: Jackson Street & Cherry Street, Manhattan, NY
